revised_title: Influence of Sliding Motion on Partial Cone Crack Formation in Brittle Materials
tldr: The article investigates the formation of partial cone cracks in brittle materials when a spherical indenter slides across the surface. The analysis shows that sliding motion significantly influences the quasistatic stress field and the geometry of the cracks. The frictional tractions affect the criteria for surface fracture and the shape of the partially developed cones, which are determined by the Poisson ratio of the material and the coefficient of friction.
